[LIST_ITEM] Overall similarity of TCR to Fab fragment of antibodies
[LIST_ITEM] Many different α/β chains expressed w/in a single individual
[LIST_ITEM] Each T cell expresses just one α/β chain --> clonally distributed
[LIST_ITEM] Assembled by somatic DNA recombination during T cell development in thymus
[LIST_ITEM] No somatic hypermutation or isotype switching
[LIST_ITEM] Deficient expression of RAGs involved in VDJ joining
[LIST_ITEM] Loss of T and B cell fxn; B cells more severely affected
[LIST_ITEM] Caused by missense RAG mutations resulting in reduced activity
[LIST_ITEM] Encoded by rearranged V and J gene segments
[LIST_ITEM] RNA splicing fuses VJ to C
[LIST_ITEM] Single cluster of V genes, two clusters of D, J, C genes
[LIST_ITEM] D to J joining occurs first followed by recombination to any of a large number of V genes
[LIST_ITEM] RNA splicing fuses VDJ to C
[LIST_ITEM] N-nucleotide addition at VJ/VDJ jxns - CDR3
[LIST_ITEM] Found w/ CD3 and TCRβ transmembrane proteins - do not differ btw receptors
[LIST_ITEM] Three CD3 proteins: γ, δ, ε form heterodimers that associate w/ TCR
[LIST_ITEM] CD3δ and ε required for transport of TCR to cell surface
[LIST_ITEM] ζ chain associates w/ TCR as homodimer
[LIST_ITEM] CD3 and ζ chain relay signals from TCR to cytoplasm
[LIST_ITEM] Contain ITAMs (tyrosine) that get phosphorylated to trigger intracellular signaling cascades
[LIST_ITEM] Peptide fragments of antigens on surface of other cells in complex w/ MHC molecules
[LIST_ITEM] TCR recognizes only the right MHC and right antigen
[LIST_ITEM] CD4/CD8 interaction sites distinct from TCR interaction sites
[LIST_ITEM] TCR and CD4 or CD8 are capable of recognizing the same MHC/peptide complex simultaneously
[LIST_ITEM] CD4 and CD8 facilitate signal transduction
[LIST_ITEM] Genes similarly organized to α/β genes
[LIST_ITEM] δ locus embedded within α gene (deleted when α rearrangements occur)
